entry.title: Re: Question about Higher-Level Item Linking in Service O...
entry.content:
Hello  @YBS ,

thanks for raising your question!

In Service Order we only support two-level hierarchy based on the functionality Service Bundle. Moreover, the main-item must be of type "Service Bundle" (fixed-price Service Bundle or Service Bundle). Based on that the item category determination is defined. This is also the reason why your item category is blank. Please take a closer look at the following SAP Help.

Best regards,
Julius - SAP Cloud ERP Consulting

entry.title: Re: BZSTDOC
entry.content:
Hi  cmfs5

For this issue, I kindly ask you to please check and apply the following SAP Notes:

1873607 - Optimized Log Configuration and Database Size for Integration Framework

1873559 - B1iF_Using the DB Purge Tool for Database Size Reduction

And also, I kindly ask you to double  check below mentioned article to control the Integration Framework logs https://help.sap.com/doc/9c200d7b20af4b5f9f29bafdb2401579/9.0/en-US/B1if%20Log%20Maintenance.pdf

1. Make sure that the B1i debug settings are set as a Production environment, as detailed in SAP Note 1873607, section "6. Best practice: Log configuration for production servers".

2. Use the B1i ‚Üí Tools ‚Üí Log Mass Deletion, to delete unnecessary logging information and maintain the size of the B1i database.

3. Perform the steps below to release any unused or fragmented space (see KBA 3107274, section A.8):

    3.1. Schedule some downtime on the HANA Server, making sure there are no connected users

    3.2. Stop the server tools, B1i and any other services that connect to the HANA instance

    3.3. Perform a Full Backup of the instance

    3.4. Restart the HANA Instance

    3.5. Execute the following SQL statements in HANA Studio:

        ALTER SYSTEM RECLAIM DATAVOLUME 120 DEFRAGMENT;

        ALTER SYSTEM RECLAIM LOG;

        ALTER SYSTEM RECLAIM COLUMN LOB SPACE;

        ALTER SYSTEM RECLAIM ROW LOB SPACE;

    3.6. Start the Server tools and other services again.

Check if BZSTDOC table size is reduced after this.

Thank You.

Kimd Regards
Nidhi
SAP Support

entry.title: Leave accrual based on working days i previous year
entry.content:
Hi @Volker_Ruof / @StephanieCR  / experts / product owners,

We are busy exploring a configuration scenario where the annual leave entitlement is determined by the number of working days in the previous year.

A working day is defined as:

  • A normal working day

  • Working on a non-working day

  • More than 4 hours of overtime booked in a day

  • Absence due to a work accident, strike, etc.
    (There are a few other basic conditions, but these are the main ones.)

The working day checks have been achieved using time valuations, which add to a counter in a time collector. This correctly calculates the number of working days.

The accrual period and account validity are based on the employee‚Äôs hire date. For example, the number of working days from 1 June 2024 to 31 May 2025 determines the entitlement for 1 June 2025.

This would have been straightforward if all employees shared the same accrual period, as we could use a flexible-period time collector. However, because the period differs per employee (based on hire date), this becomes more complex.

We are currently considering two possible approaches and would appreciate your feedback or alternative suggestions:

Scenario 1:
Leverage a workaround within the decision or calculation rule (details can be shared privately with product owners or experts) to manipulate or assign values to the time valuation/time type group, thereby determining working days for the relevant annual period.

Scenario 2:
Use a daily time collector that writes to a custom object. The accrual rule would then read the value from this custom object, populated via an onSave rule in the timesheet or time type groups.
The downside is potential performance issues, and it would not automatically capture retrospective timesheet changes unless the timesheet is re-saved.

Would love to hear your thoughts, feedback or alternative approaches.

Thank you!

 

SAP SuccessFactors Time Tracking

entry.title: Double GR Posting- Locking Issue
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am facing this issue recently, we have the control key as PP02(Auto GR), While completing the last operation in DM   yield is posted and then goods receipt is automatically posted. So when order Qty is 2, GR  Qty is 2 obviously.

But in some situations while DM posting the last operation locking issue occurs, causing the posting to occur in COGI. When we reprocess the COGI entry, another 101 movement is also triggered.

As a result, Order Qty is 2, GR posting is 4 -> 2Qty (MB31-AutoGR) and Second GR - 2QTY COGI.

Pls suggest me configuration changes which can be made to stop this issue.

entry.title: SAP Community Hobbies Series ‚Äì Colors, Creativity, and Canvases ‚Äì Sandra Sol√≠s
entry.content:
Just like smarchesini enjoys discovering and connecting with places through
running, I also love to connect with the places I visit ‚Äî but through painting. I‚Äôm
excited to continue the SAP Community Hobbies series by sharing another passion
that takes me away from the keyboard yet still connects back in surprising ways:
drawing and painting.

A Little About Me and My Hobby

Hello everyone! My name is Sandra Sol√≠s, I‚Äôm an ABAP developer from Mexico and also the creator of the YouTube channel Mundo Abaper, where I share ABAP content in Spanish. Like Sebastiano, I enjoy running, making ABAP content of course, but the hobby that truly wins my heart is drawing and painting.

Over the years, I‚Äôve explored many techniques‚Äîcolored pencils, charcoal, watercolor, acrylics, and even coffee painting. For me, every medium has its own charm and challenge.

How It All Started

My journey with art began when I was 15 years old, in secondary school, when I took an art class, and that‚Äôs when I started practicing this hobby. What started as curiosity became a lifelong practice‚Äî20 years now! Since then, my sketchbooks, canvases, and brushes have been my constant companions.

What I Love Most

When I paint, the world slows down. It‚Äôs just me and the canvas. This hobby gives me a moment of peace but also sparks unexpected creativity for my programming work. Many times, while drawing, a solution to an ABAP problem suddenly comes to my mind.

Connecting Art with SAP

At first glance, painting may seem far from the SAP world. But here‚Äôs where I find the link:

Visual thinking: Sketching helps me structure ideas, the same way I design solutions. It also helps me take notes with small drawings, which makes it easier to understand what I study and read.

  • Creative problem-solving: When I feel overwhelmed or can‚Äôt find a solution, I step away and start painting. Suddenly, while I‚Äôm painting, some answers appear, helping me get unstuck and find solutions.
  • Content creation: For my Mundo Abaper videos, I often use drawings and visual notes to explain concepts more clearly.

So while brushes and SAP might seem unrelated, creativity is the bridge between them.

Challenges Along the Way

Art is not always easy. Portraits, for example, are especially challenging‚Äîcapturing the essence of a face requires patience and practice. Learning each new technique (like watercolor vs. charcoal) also brings its own learning curve. I‚Äôve overcome these challenges through courses and, most importantly, constant practice.

Proud Moments

Some highlights of my artistic journey:

  • Portraits of the SAP Developer Advocates‚Äîpainted with coffee!

 

  • My travel journal, a tiny handmade sketchbook filled with paintings of the beautiful places I‚Äôve visited, here I show just a few ones on my sketchbook . 

    

    

  • A charcoal portrait of Madona

  • My favorite superhero in colored pencils.

  • And one special project: a handmade badge painted with acrylics that I use as a background for my videos.

I even have a iman that I use as watercolor pallet of Paint !!! perfect match between computers and painting, dont you think??

 

Myths About Painting

Many people believe painting or drawing is only for those ‚Äúborn with talent.‚Äù I strongly disagree. With a good mentor and consistent practice, anyone can improve‚Äîyes, even to the level of Van Gogh!

Tips for Beginners

  • Start with the fundamentals, no matter which painting technique you choose, they all share the same, learn lines, dots, perspective, volume, shadows, light, and composition.
  • Once you‚Äôre comfortable, choose a technique you like‚Äîwatercolor, pencils, charcoal‚Äîand deepen your skills there.

Where to Learn More

There are countless resources, both free and paid. My personal recommendation: start with YouTube tutorials to get the basics, then take structured courses to refine your technique.

As you can see, art, is more than a hobby‚Äîit‚Äôs a way to recharge, connect with us, and even find inspiration for our SAP work. I‚Äôd love to hear from you too: What hobby fuels your creativity outside of SAP?

Passing the Baton

Next, I‚Äôd like to forward to Riney Riley, who will share an exciting hobby of skydiving

entry.title: Automating SAP Business One Sales Reporting with n8n, AI, and Telegram
entry.content:
Introduction

This workflow integrates SAP Business One data through the Service Layer with Google Sheets and Telegram. The purpose of this workflow is to automate sales reporting process by automatically retrieving new sales orders, updating google sheets with new orders, and delivering daily summaries via Telegram. Google‚Äôs Gemma AI used in this workflow to add extra insights and analyze the consolidated data in order to highlighting top performers, upcoming due dates, and extracting sales trends by removing manual data exports and providing real-time visibility of sales performance.

 

Technical Architecture

The workflow includes two main stages. First, it connects to the Service Layer to retrieve sales orders data with the help of OData queries, filters out duplicates orders, and appends new orders to Google Sheets. Second, it uses JavaScript code to format the data, create structured AI prompts, and deliver the finalized reports through a Telegram Bot. (The social platfrom can be vary based on the user requirements.)

Prerequisites

  • SAP Business One Access: A valid database with authorized username, password, and active Service Layer. (SBODemoUS data used in this tutorial)
  • Docker: Docker Desktop used to deploy n8n.
  • Google Account: Google Sheets and Google API setup.
  • Telegram Account: A Telegram account to create a bot and obtain a user ID for notifications. (this can be applicable to any other platform)
  • n8n Account: n8n account for deploying and configuring workflows.
  • Javascript: JavaScript syntax used to in n8n nodes.

Implementation Steps

The workflow follows these stages:

  1. Deploying n8n on the server
  2. SAP Business One Integration
  3. Validate SAP Business One data
  4. Create automated workflow
  5. Google Sheets Data Synchronization
  6. Sales Analysis in Google Sheets
  7. AI-Powered Sales Insights
  8. Automated Reporting to Telegram

Implementation

The process starts by checking the latest sales orders in SAP Business One:

Next step is to deploy n8n in Docker and set up Service Layer using HTTP nodes for login and data retrieval. Example OData query would be like this:

https://server:50000/b1s/v1/Orders?$select=DocEntry,DocDate,CardName&$orderby=DocEntry desc&$top=10

A JavaScript code node also handles duplicate checking. It can grab existing rows from Google Sheets, pulls out DocEntry values, and filters SAP data to include only new sales orders. This prevent duplication when the workflow runs multiple times.

For having AI analysis, a JavaScript node formats the sales data into a prompt and calculates daily totals, identify top performers, and computes monthly averages. The prompt asks Gemma AI to generate a report with a performance summary, and alerts. Finally, the Telegram node sends the formatted report to specific user id, including the date, total sales, top performers, AI insights, and upcoming due dates.

Final Thoughts

This workflow automates sales order retrieval from SAP Business One through Service Layer and syncs new orders to Google Sheets. By using n8n, it delivers daily reports via Telegram and remove the need for manual data exports. The implementation requirements are SAP Business One Service Layer, Docker, n8n, and JavaScript to perform calculations with AI assistance. Although calculations can be done with just code, AI can help to get extra insights based on the given prompt. Beyond sales reporting, this approach can be applied to other modules such as purchasing, inventory management, or crm and making it a cost-effective alternative to enterprise automation platforms.

 

Resources 

The full guide is available as a PDF with step-by-step instructions and screenshots. The JavaScript code is in GitHub with comments.

  • Full Guide PDF
  • GitHub Repository

 

Prepared by

Amirhossein Tonekaboni
SAP Business One Consultant

  • LinkedIn
  • Portfolio

entry.title: Re: Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Setup Guide
entry.content:
@nageshcaparthy - Thanks for a well-documented guide.
I observed one thing, in your guide, when creating the SAP_COM_0193 communication arrangement, it is mentioned to use the S4HANA URL domain as the HOST. 

However in the SAP Mission -

Activate Joule with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, it is mentioned to use the IAS tenant (Cloud Identity Service) domain as the HOST. 
 
This was possibly the reason why no user roles were replicated from S4HANA system to SAP Build Workzone and Joule considered everyone as unauthorised users. Due to this, Joule never answered our queries correctly or atleast the answers were very generic and vague.
After I made the changes in the HOST, the IPS was able to extract the user roles from S4HANA cloud system and replicate them to BUILD workzone. With the authorization of the users now available, Joule became more accurate and decisive and was now able to answer queries and also show navigational links based on the queries.

entry.title: Re: Product hierarchy IN MATERIAL MASTER ?
entry.content: Hello, I have a question on the logics -How do we differentiate between Product Hierarchy & Material Classification? Would it be possible to build those hierarchies also under material classifications, since a company also consider raw materials or spare parts as material categories and not only products to sell. For sure I am aware that both can be used at the same time but wouldn't this create redundancy? Thanks

entry.title: Re: How to create multi dimensional product hierarchy in material master
entry.content: Hi @VeselinaPeykova, I would have a similar question - does Product Hierarchy only make sense for material "categorization" when it comes to products to sell? In our company we will not have too many different material types but we are aiming a hierarchy below the material type. For example Semi-Finished, Finished products but also raw materials or spare parts for the production. The concern here is when strictly dividing material classification agains product hierarchy that we have a redundant hierarchy system, because it needs to be maintained on the one site for sold products on product hierarchy and on the other side for "internal" materials on the classification. But sometimes a material can also be both, sometimes sold but mostly used for production etc. I am really surprised that there is not so much information on such use cases. Thanks!

entry.title: Saudi Arabia: Violation and Sanction
entry.content:
What is the issue we are trying to solve?

In accordance with Saudi labor law, businesses often face several violations and sanctions that can adversely affect employee growth and compensation. To address these challenges, we have implemented a robust solution using SAP‚Äôs Employee Central and Employee Central Payroll. This administrative service is designed to effectively capture penalties, occurrences, and deduction amounts, ensuring compliance and supporting a fair and transparent workplace for employees.

What are the main components of the solution?

In this blog, we‚Äôll walk through the end-to-end design for capturing violations and sanctions in SAP SuccessFactors, ensuring both compliance and transparency.

You need to bring several components together to build one solution that can achieve your goal
  1. Picklist
  2. Object definition
  3. business rules
  4. Integration center
  5. Configure people profile
  6. Wrapping Up Phase One
  7. What‚Äôs Next?
are you ready, let's start with our first process

 

1. Picklists

1.1 Violation Category

Where it includes 3 categories based on Saudi labor law:

  • Working Hours Violations
  • Work Organization Violations
  • Worker Behavior Violations

 

1.2Violation Type 

Which is the child picklist for one of violation categories we must map it with.

 

Note: to create any picklist please go to Picklist center tool or from import export Data to upload it *you can use our template as reference to create or upload the violation categories and types*

"Now let's create the object definitions"

2. Object Definition

2.1 Object definition for violation Pranet:

As part of building a custom solution to manage employee violations and related sanctions in SAP SuccessFactors, I started by creating a parent MDF object named "Violations and Sanctions" (cust_ViolationsAndSanctions).

This object serves as the main record holder that links employee violations to the disciplinary actions taken, allowing HR to track and manage policy enforcement efficiently.

Key Highlights:

  • Effective Dating: Set to Basic to track start and end dates.
  • API Visibility: Editable, enabling future integrations or automations.
  • Subject User Field: Uses UserID to tie the record to the employee.
  • Object Category: User Transactional, making it available in employee profiles if needed.
  • Association: A one-to-many composite association has been created to link this object with a detailed child object that will store specific violation/sanction actions. 

2.2 Child object of violation and Sanction

To support the parent record, I created a child object named "Violations and Sanctions Details" (cust_ViolationsAndSanctionsDetails). This object is designed to capture detailed information about each individual violation or disciplinary action linked to the main case.

It‚Äôs structured with multiple custom fields, enabling granular tracking of both violation types and the corresponding sanctions.

Key Highlights:

  • Effective Dating: From Parent ‚Äî ensures synchronization with the parent object.
  • Data Model: Includes a rich set of fields, including:
    • cust_ViolationCategory (Picklist)
    • cust_ViolationType (Picklist)
    • cust_SanctionType (Picklist)
    • cust_Occurrence (Number of times the violation occurred)
    • cust_SeverityLevel (Picklist)
    • cust_ActionTaken (String)
    • cust_StartDate / cust_EndDate (Dates for sanction period)
    • cust_AmountDeducted (Decimal ‚Äî for fines or deductions)
    • cust_Comment (Long text ‚Äî additional notes)
  • Reference Fields:
    • cust_EmployeeName (User)
    • cust_CreatedBy, cust_CreatedDate, etc. ‚Äî for auditing
  • Association: This child object is linked via a composite association to the parent object cust_ViolationsAndSanctions, which controls its lifecycle.

This structure allows the system to hold multiple violation/sanction records per employee under one umbrella case, offering full flexibility and traceability.

 

"With our picklists and MDF objects ready, it‚Äôs time to connect the dots"

2.2.1 Mapping picklist and business rules Business Rules to the Violation & Sanction details (object definition)

After creating child object definition, you have to map our picklists (violation category and type) to it.

Violation Category

Violation Type:

 

2.2.2 Mapping the business rule with child object definition has been explained in below screenshot where the configuration of these business rules will be described later.

2.3 Sanction lookup object definition

To enhance automation and flexibility in managing disciplinary actions, I created a lookup object called "Sanctions Lookup" (cust_SanctionsLookup). This object acts as a reference table that links violation types to predefined sanction types and their associated penalty percentages.

It enables easy maintenance of sanction rules and supports business rule logic for automated decision-making.

Key Highlights:

  • Effective Dating: None ‚Äî since this is a static lookup table.
  • Status: Active
  • API Visibility: Not Visible ‚Äî internal use only.
  • Object Category: Generic Object Change Requests ‚Äî indicates it‚Äôs maintained via MDF UI.

Field Design:

  • cust_ViolationType: Picklist ‚Äî the category of violation
  • cust_SanctionType01 to cust_SanctionType04: Strings ‚Äî predefined sanctions for each level
  • cust_DailyRatePerc01 to cust_DailyRatePerc04: Numbers ‚Äî penalty percentage tied to each sanction level

This design supports a tiered approach, allowing different sanctions and deduction percentages based on the severity or repetition of the violation.

 

 

Note:

You have to upload one excel file after creating this object in Import and Export Data to capture all sanction types and rate

*you can find the full template under our Mena user Group*

"Now that we‚Äôve set up our objects and picklists, it‚Äôs time to bring logic into action ‚Äî let‚Äôs start building the business rules that will drive our Violation and Sanction process."

3. Business rules 

3.1 Violation Count

Reset Violation Count After 6 Months

To ensure fair evaluation of employee behavior over time, I created a business rule that resets the violation occurrence count if the last recorded violation happened more than 6 months ago.

This rule helps HR treat old violations as expired, allowing employees to rebuild a clean record if no further infractions occur within the defined period.

3.2 Calculate Sanction Amount

First Business rule we will explain is Calculate Sanction Amount As part of automating the sanctions process, I created a business rule to dynamically calculate the sanction amount based on the selected violation and its associated penalty percentage from the lookup object.

 

3.3 Violation Evaluation

To support consistent enforcement of disciplinary policies, I created a business rule that evaluates the number of occurrences for each violation type. Based on this count, the system automatically determines the appropriate sanction type and its corresponding penalty rate by referencing the Sanctions Lookup object.

"After completing the business rules that automate the evaluation and sanction logic, it‚Äôs time to move to the final stage ‚Äî integrating the violation penalties with payroll through the Integration Center."

4. Integration Center (deduction record)

After setting up the objects and business rules, the final task is to export the calculated sanction amount into Employee Central‚Äôs Non‚ÄëRecurring Deduction (NRD) portlet . Here‚Äôs how to accomplish that:

4.1 Choose Integration Type

4.2 configure Fields

Mapping violation and sanction details and one-time payment

  • Pay Component (payComponentCode) String<<--PayComponent (cust_PayComponent) from Violations and Sanctions Details
  • Issue Date (payDate) DateTime<<--ViolationDate (cust_ViolationDate) from Violations and Sanctions Details
  • User ID (userId) String(100)<<--Violations and Sanctions_UserID (cust_ViolationsAndSanctions_UserID) from Violations and Sanctions Details

  • Currency (currencyCode) String(20)<<--SAR
  • Amount (value) Double<<--SanctionAmount (cust_SanctionAmount) from Violations and Sanctions Details 
4.3 Filter and Sort

To apply filters that limit which records are selected for processing/export based on date/time and other criteria. This is especially useful for incremental loads or scheduled integrations.

These help filter data based on when records were modified or effective.

  1. Modified Since Query Mode:
    • Modified Since ‚Äì Only fetch records changed since a given time.
    • Effective Dated ‚Äì Based on start or end dates.
    • Dropdown with options like:
    • You selected Modified Since, meaning you're pulling only records that were modified after a certain time.
  1.  Effective As Of / Effective From / Effective To:
  • These are optional date filters based on the record's effective date range (usually for MDF objects).
  • Example: You might use ‚ÄúEffective From‚Äù = 01/01/2024 to fetch records starting in 2024.
  1.  Last Run Time:
  • Shows the timestamp of the last time this integration was run.

4.4 Scheduling & Review and Run

As the final step in the Integration Center configuration, it is essential to schedule the integration to run daily at a specific time to ensure consistent and timely data replication. This guarantees that any updates or changes are processed automatically without manual intervention.

After scheduling, utilize the "Review and Run" functionality to verify that the integration setup is functioning correctly. This step allows you to review the configuration, where you can also download a report to check if any error happen.

"With the integration setup complete, the next step is to return to the MDF configuration to refine the object behavior, field mappings, and any additional enhancements needed for end-user visibility."

5. Add the MDF

5.1 Manage Configure UI:

Step-by-Step Process to Create the UI

  1. Navigate to "Manage Configuration UI"
  • Go to Admin Center > Manage Configuration UI
  • Click Create New
  1. Select the Base Object
  • Choose: Violations and Sanctions
    • This is your custom MDF object that stores the core data like UserID, Effective Start Date, and other violation-related fields.
  1. Configure Header Section (Parent Object)

The top section contains key fields from the main object:

  • UserID: Employee for whom the violation is being recorded.
  • Effective Start Date: When the violation record becomes active.
  • external Name: Usually auto-filled or manually entered for reporting/search purposes.

  1. Add Child Object Section (VS)

This section represents entries from a composite child object (named something like ‚ÄúVS‚Äù):

  • Violation Category: Picklist to classify the type (e.g., Attendance, Conduct).
  • Violation Type: Specific type within the category.
  • Violation Date: When the violation occurred.
  • Occurrence: A calculated or input field indicating how many times this violation has occurred.

     

 

  • You can click ‚ÄúDetails‚Äù to see or edit extended child object fields (e.g., sanction rate, type, amount, etc.).

  1. Field Customization and Layout
  • You may add, hide, reorder, or group fields for better clarity.
  • Optionally, use rule-based visibility or field-level permissions to control access.
  1. Save the UI
  • Click Save to publish the UI.
  • This makes it available via Manage Data or People Profile (if configured

 

5.2 People profile

To allow HR teams and authorized users to view or manage violation and sanction records directly from the employee's profile, we need to configure a custom portlet in the People Profile. Go to:

  1. Admin Center > Configure People Profile
  2. Choose the Profile Section where you'd like to add the portlet (e.g., under Employee Info or Custom Sections)
  3. Click ‚ÄúAdd Block‚Äù, then choose:
    • Block Type: MDF-based
    • MDF Object: Violations and Sanctions (cust_VS)
  4. Set the Title: You can name the section "Violations and Sanctions" or customize as needed.

Note: don‚Äôt forget to set the Permission role for your HR admin or any other users

 

  • Note: To ensure accurate tracking and avoid data duplication in both violation history and payroll deductions, we recommend that users:
  • Edit the existing violation record and update it with the new occurrence details, rather than creating a new entry for each incident.

6. Wrapping Up Phase One

With this first phase, we've successfully laid the foundation for managing employee violations and sanctions in SAP SuccessFactors. This included building:

  • A structured parent-child object model for capturing violations and related sanctions
  • A lookup object to define policy rules and penalties
  • Key business rules to automate evaluation, calculation, and reset logic

This setup empowers HR teams to handle disciplinary actions in a consistent, fair, and data-driven manner.

7. What‚Äôs Next?

In the upcoming phase, we plan to extend this framework by integrating:

  • Time tracking data (e.g., lateness, absence) to trigger violations automatically
  • Other HR processes like grievance ,

With this setup, the Violation Management solution becomes a fully connected and compliant process that strengthens transparency and fairness across the workforce. The full blog on Violations and Sanctions is in progress and will soon be shared in the MENA SAP User Group space ‚Äî a place for us to exchange ideas, share feedback, and learn from each other‚Äôs experiences.

Stay tuned for Phase Two

entry.title: SAP Ariba Sourcing & Contracts 2511 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
SAP Ariba Contracts - Feature highlights

AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Contracts (SCONTR-1279)

Joule, SAP's generative AI copilot, is now available in SAP Ariba Contracts. Joule uses a conversational interface to help users complete tasks efficiently.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Supplier Eligibility Validation in Contract Workspaces (SCONTR-1445)

This feature enables buyers to set supplier eligibility criteria using supplier registration and qualification statuses from SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance. It ensures that only suppliers who meet the specified eligibility criteria are included in a contract. These criteria can be validated during various stages, such as during contract creation, publication, or when transferring contract data and line items to integrated external systems like SAP ERP.

View implementation details and more here.

 

 

SAP Ariba Sourcing - Feature highlights

Ability to Block Access to Classic Sourcing for Project or Event Creation

(PSOURCE-1452)

This feature blocks product sourcing users from creating sourcing projects and requests in the classic SAP Ariba Sourcing interface. To create sourcing projects or events, users can use the guided sourcing interface, which streamlines the process and helps users complete more projects with less effort.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Ability to Add Plants to Material Line Items in Hybrid Mode

(PSOURCE-1468)

This feature allows you to associate a plant with material line items (not associated with any BOMs) in hybrid mode within product sourcing. This improves the creation of Purchase Info Records (PIRs) by automatically collecting prices for material line items in product sourcing.

Business End User Tasks

Creating a Purchase Info Record from a Material Line Item Linked to a Plant

View implementation details and more here.

 

Ability to Upload CSV File to Autofill Term Values for Material Quote Events in Product Sourcing

(SOURCE-1641)

 

This feature provides system administrators an interface to upload a CSV file that includes predefined term values. These values are used to autofill term values when a new material quote event is created in product sourcing.

Previously, the system prefilled term values in a material quote event only from matching terms in the most recently awarded event. As a result, users had to enter term values manually for every new material quote event.

Now, the system prefills term values from a CSV file uploaded by the system administrator. When a new material quote event is created, the system reuses term values based on the following values:

  • TermID

  • TermName

  • MaterialID

  • SAPPlantID

  • SAPSupplierID

This feature is supported for Approved Manufacturer List (AML) suppliers only.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Ability to Add, Update, Remove URLs in Guided Sourcing Full Projects

(SOURCE-2542)

 

With this feature, project owners can add, update, and delete URLs in the Events and other documents section of a guided sourcing full project.

The option to add URLs is added under Create > Document in the Events and other documents section in guided sourcing full projects.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

View implementation details and more here.

 

Exclude Reverted Savings Allocations in Analytical Reports in Guided Sourcing

(SOURCE-2559)

This feature ensures that when draft savings allocations are reverted to the published state, the draft allocations are discarded. Consequently, only active (non-reverted) allocations are included in analytical reports generated from savings forms in guided sourcing full projects.

Previously, analytical reports generated from savings forms in guided sourcing full projects included all savings allocations, including those reverted from drafts. With this feature, these reports now only include active (non-reverted) savings allocations.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Ability to Export All Rows from Content Tables in Guided Sourcing Events

(SOURCE-2590)

 

This feature enables buyer users to export the complete set of rows from content tables within guided sourcing events.

Changes to the User Interface

  • The Export all rows option is added to the download icon (ÓÄ∫) for the following event pages in guided sourcing:

    • The Monitor page: In the Items that needs quotes and the Questions, requirements, and attachments tables

    • The Award page: In the Award allocation and Questions, requirements, and attachments tables

View implementation details and more here.

 

Additional Contract Workspace Types in Guided Sourcing Full Projects

(SOURCE-2595)

 

This feature adds additional contract workspace document type options to guided sourcing full projects.

Currently, in the Events and other documents section of guided souring full projects, you can create a Contract workspace document as only the Procurement type. This feature adds the following additional Contract workspace document types:

  • Sales

  • Internal

View implementation details and more here.

 

Ability to Import and Export Event Content in XLSX Format in Sourcing

(SOURCE-2596)

This feature enables buyers to import and export event content in SAP Ariba Sourcing in the XLSX format.

Previously, event content could only be exported and imported in the XLS format. With this feature, both XLS and XLSX formats are supported. While XLSX is set as the default export format, you can still opt for XLS based on your preference.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Communication Support in SAP Business Network Discovery Postings for Sourcing Events 

(SOURCE-2640)

This feature enables communication between buyers and suppliers in SAP Business Network Discovery postings for sourcing events. Buyers can directly respond to supplier-initiated questions, send messages to suppliers, and receive responses within the event posting.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Automatic Initial Offer Submissions in Guided Sourcing 

(SOURCE-2647)

 

This feature adds the ability to copy participants and bids from a past event to a new event and use the past bids as initial bid submissions in the new event.

Previously in guided sourcing, buyer users needed to use a multi-round event to reuse bids as initial bids for subsequent rounds. Users couldn't copy bids from a past single event to a new single event. Now, buyer users can copy participants and items with their associated bids from past single events and reuse the bids as initial bids in a new single event.

For the buyer, this feature ensures that supplier bids remain unchanged between events, without the need for a multi-round event. This also gives suppliers the option to not login and interface with the event unless they want to modify their bid, which saves time for the supplier.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Ability to Generate Event Summary in Guided Sourcing Using Generative AI (SOURCE-2670)

 

This feature enables buyer users to generate event summary in guided sourcing utilizing generative AI capabilities.

The summary is generated using the following data from the sourcing event: ID,Title,Description,Type,Base Language,Currency,Owner,Display Version,Contract Months,Contract Effective Date,Contract Expiration Date,Baseline Spend,Target Saving Percentage,Create Date,Last Modified,Origin,Template, and Supplier Bids.

The summary is generated in the event's base language, not the user's locale. It is created at the event level, so all users can see the same summary. If a user chooses to regenerate the summary, it is based on the data visible to that user, not the overall event data.

Note: This premium feature is available at no cost during the trial period.

View implementation details and more here.

 

View Predecessor Projects in Analytical Reports in Guided Sourcing 

(SOURCE-2694)

 

This feature enables you to view predecessor project details in analytical reports for sourcing requests, events, and full projects in guided sourcing.

Previously, predecessor project details were not included in analytical reports for sourcing requests, events, and full projects in guided sourcing. With this feature, you can now add the Predecessor Project column on the Pivot Layout page of the report wizard when creating an analytical report. Once added, these details will appear in the Predecessor Project column in reports. However, data from projects originally created using the classic SAP Ariba Sourcing interface will appear in the Based on Project column instead of the new Predecessor Project column.

Changes to the User Interface

On the Pivot Layout page of the analytical report wizard, a new field, Predecessor Project, is added for sourcing requests, events, and full projects in guided sourcing.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Access Controls for Task Comments 

(SOURCE-2716)

 

This feature adds access controls for task comments in guided sourcing full projects.

You can now specify which user groups can access task comments in a guided sourcing full project. Only users with the specified access permissions, or the Project Owner, can see an access controlled comment. Project Owners can view all task comments. Access controls are chosen below the comment. Comments that do not use access controls are visible to all project members.

Changes to the User Interface

Task detail pages now include Access control options below the the comment field. Click the button on the right side of the Access control field to choose options.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Ability to Make Counter-offers in Guided Sourcing Events 

(SSINDUSTRY-517)

This feature enables buyers to propose counteroffers to suppliers during a new round of a sourcing event. A counteroffer is a special type of negotiation round in multi-round bidding, giving buyers an additional way to secure competitive pricing from suppliers.

Previously, buyers could not propose a take-it-or-leave-it offer to suppliers.

With this enhancement, buyers can do the following:

  • Set a specific price as a counteroffer in a new round.

  • Share the counteroffer with selected suppliers.

Supplier can respond to the counter offer in the following manner:

  • If suppliers accept, the counteroffer price is recorded as their submitted quote for that line item. Buyers can then either proceed to awarding or start another negotiation round.

  • If there is no response from suppliers, their previously submitted quote remains valid and continues in the event.

View implementation details and more here.

 

 

 

Stay connected with our community for more insights and updates:

  • Register for the Early Release Series for 2511 release- Multi-registration link and for CIM customers- P2P link 
  • Feature related materials:
    • SAP Ariba Connect - Release Readiness (Customers except CIM)
    • Readiness Community page (For CIM customers)
  • SAP Community for Intelligent Spend Management page
  • SAP Help Portal pages - Procurement  
  • What‚Äôs New

entry.title: XPORG and XEORG authorization fields are not being restricted to assigned values
entry.content:
Hello,

I am currently working on a project where the customer has made XPORG (Purchasing Organization) and XEORG (Planning and Execution Organization) organizational authorization fields. However, end users are able to see values outside of what is assigned to them in these fields.

When I checked user trace, I found that a user going into a transaction that would have an authority check for these fields is not passing an authority check or at least it is not being logged by user trace. Does anyone know what I can do to make sure users do not access values beyond those assigned to them for these two specific fields?

To give some additional information:
- Correct authorization has been given to users and roles do not contain the values they are able to access
- There are no XPGRP (Purchasing Group) and XEGRP (Planning and Execution Group) values added to the system

entry.title: Usage of standard Workflow Steps reuse library in your custom free-styled Fiori apps
entry.content:
Hi All,

During the development of a custom free-styled UI5 app, I received a request to integrate the workflow steps component from a standard app into the custom app.

The Component is used in different standard SAP apps, and it normally looks like this:

In the standard SAP Fiori apps, this component can show different workflow steps of a particular document, and if you press one line item, it will navigate to an object page where it shows a bit more details of this step.

The requirement I received is to show the component in my custom app's object page. Only columns Type, Name, Status, and Recipients in the list should be visible, and the line item navigation should be removed.

Here is what I achieved in my app:

View

Add below ComponentContainer into the correct page section.

<uxap:ObjectPageSection title="{i18n>prApprovalDetails}" titleUppercase="false">
  <uxap:subSections>
    <uxap:ObjectPageSubSection id="workflowPRSection" title="{i18n>prApprovalDetails}">
      <core:ComponentContainer id="workflowPRComponentContainer" propagateModel="true" height="100%"/>
    </uxap:ObjectPageSubSection>
  </uxap:subSections>
</uxap:ObjectPageSection>

 

Controller

Function to create approval details component, using re-use library stworkflowinstance. 

This whole createComponent part was found in one of the standard Fiori app, which consumed the workflow steps library, and I edited it by the request I received to make it work.

_loadPoConWfContainer: function (workflowInstanceId, scenarioID, ID, parentControlId) {
  let _parentControl = this.byId(parentControlId);
  _parentControl.setBusy(true);
  let sWorkflowInstanceId = workflowInstanceId;
  let sScenarioID = scenarioID;
  if (!this.oPoWfComponent) {
    var _control = this.byId(ID);
    let oPoWfComponent = sap.ui
    .getCore()
    .createComponent({
      name: "sap.io.bpm.sworkfloweditor.lib.reuse.stworkflowinstance",
      async: true,
      title: "{{workflowComponentTitle}}",
      settings: {
        objectIdentifier: sWorkflowInstanceId,
        scenarioId: sScenarioID,
        objectContext: "empty string",
      },
    })
    .then(
      function (successValue) {
        let oWorkflowComponent = successValue;
        oWorkflowComponent.setScenarioId(scenarioID);
        oWorkflowComponent.setObjectIdentifier(sWorkflowInstanceId);
        oWorkflowComponent.setIsDraft(false);
        oWorkflowComponent.initWorkflow().then(
          function () {
            _control.setComponent(oWorkflowComponent);
            _parentControl.setBusy(false);
          }
        );
        this.oWorkflowComponent = oWorkflowComponent;
        try {
          var embeddedComponent = this.oWorkflowComponent.getRootControl().getContent()[0].getContent()[1];
          embeddedComponent.attachComponentCreated(function (oEvent) {
            var steps = oEvent.getParameter("component").getRootControl().getContent()[0].getItems();
            for (var i = 0; i < steps.length; i++) {
              steps[i].setType("Inactive");
            }
            let columns = oEvent.getParameter("component").getRootControl().getContent()[0].getColumns();
            columns.forEach((column) => {
              if (column.sId.indexOf("columnProcessors") > -1) {
                column.mBindingInfos = {};
              }
            });
            for (var j = 0; j < columns.length; j++) {
              if (
                columns[j].sId.indexOf("columnDeadline") > -1 ||
                columns[j].sId.indexOf("columnProcessors") > -1 ||
                columns[j].sId.indexOf("columnFirstProperty") > -1
              ) {
                columns[j].setVisible(false);
              }
            }
          });
        } catch (e) {
          _parentControl.setBusy(false);
        }
      }.bind(this)
    );
  }
},

You can find the parameters used in the function:

workflowInstanceId: Workflow instance ID , which is the document number like PO or PR number
scenarioID: Workflow scenario ID
ID: ComponentContainer ID
parentControlId: ObjectPageSection ID

After the embeddedComponent created, I try to fetch the workflow step list to hide columns and set the line item as inactive to avoid the line item navigation.  

 

By the above code, you can implement the Workflow Steps component in your custom free-styled Fiori app. 

Thanks,

Daniel

entry.title: Re: Master Data Sync in Public Dimension using Hybrid Stories and Scripting in SAC
entry.content:
Hi Ajay,

If you are working with public dimensions in this way, I‚Äôd suggest looking at the Data Export API available for the model. The Data Export API exposes both master data for public dimensions and fact data. By leveraging the Data Export API for master data, you can create a data import job that loads master data from one dimension onto another public dimension, essentially loading the data from SAC back onto itself.

Basic steps are as follows:

  1. Register an OAuth client in SAC if you don‚Äôt already have one. This will generate the client secret and related credentials needed for the next step.
  2. Create a new OData Services connection in SAC, pointing to SAC itself. Use OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials authentication, with credentials from step 1. The Data Service URL will be the Data Export API for your source model:
    https://{your-sac-host}/api/v1/dataexport/providers/sac/{your-model-id}.
  3. Go to your target Public Dimension (the dimension you want to load into). In the Data Management view, create a new import job using the connection you just created as the source.
  4. On the first screen, you‚Äôll see a list of ‚Äútables‚Äù exposed by the service, including all dimension master data (private and public). Select the source dimension.
  5. Define your query, selecting the source fields (one of which should be the key for the target dimension) and apply any filters you need, for example, Flag = 'Y'.
  6. Create any required transformations and complete the mappings to the target dimension. You can map only the properties you wish to update; everything else will remain unchanged.
  7. Once the Data Import job is created, execute it using a MultiAction. MultiActions allow you to include a Data Import job as a step. After creation, the MultiAction can be triggered from a story or scheduled in the SAC Calendar. For instance, we have a Data Import job using this approach that runs every 15 minutes to update a public dimension.

This approach scales well because all processing occurs natively within the SAC cloud environment rather than in a client browser. It also avoids the data volume limitations of scripting APIs. For example, while your scripting is limited to 2,000 / 200,000 members depending on method, the Data Import solution supports up to 800,000 rows and allows filtering to be built directly into the query (for example, pushing Flag = 'Y' into the query itself). In contrast, scripting would still need to process all members to identify the subset to update.

I hope this is useful.

Cheers, Ivan.

entry.title: AI-innovations in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025
entry.content:
The release of SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 marks a significant leap forward in enterprise automation and intelligence, as presented in this product blog by @BeSchulze. This release, the result of two years of focused development, places artificial intelligence at the core ‚Äì seamlessly integrated across business areas to redefine how work gets done.

Central to this update is the new agentic AI framework, where task-specific agents work together under the orchestration of our copilot Joule. More than just assistance, SAP‚Äôs persona-based AI acts as the new interface ‚Äì guiding users through processes, answering questions, and delivering relevant insights within the tools they use every day. Customers can now experience improved transparency, faster decision-making, and simplified operations, with intelligent capabilities integrated directly into their business flow.

Dive into the accompanying video for a glimpse of how these AI-driven capabilities are transforming daily work and setting a new benchmark for enterprise management.

 

 

Agentic Use cases

Asset Management: Maintenance Planner

In the area of Asset Management, planning maintenance activities often requires seamless access to the right tools at the right time. The Maintenance Planner feature, newly integrated with Joule, enhances this process by providing direct navigation to scheduling applications within SAP S/4HANA Asset Management. This innovation means that maintenance planners no longer need to sift through catalogs, as they can intuitively access relevant apps directly from their conversations, such as asking, "How to visualize maintenance work?" and receiving immediate links to resource scheduling applications. By embedding SAP Help documentation into Joule‚Äôs conversational responses, planners gain quick insights and can focus more on optimally scheduling maintenance tasks, thus ensuring that assets are well-managed without the hassle of navigation detours.

Eager to learn more? Check out our SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

 

Finance: Simpliyfying invoice dispute with the dispute manager

Untangling an incorrect invoice can feel like detective work, searching for clues across different systems. Now, with the Dispute Manager agent in SAP Cloud ERP Private your finance team has a new partner. A finance expert can simply ask Joule to pull up a dispute case by its number or show recent invoices for a customer. From that single conversation, they can review the details and then instruct Joule to either reject the dispute or navigate them directly to the app to create a credit note. This conversational approach turns a complex, multi-step investigation into a streamlined and guided dialogue. It not only saves valuable time for your team but also leads to quicker resolutions, helping maintain positive customer relationships.

For more information, please refer to the SAP Help Portal.

 

Finance: Empowering Trade Classification with an AI Agent  

Imagine trying to import a new fitness tracker and facing a complex web of customs classifications, where one wrong choice could mean costly delays. The Joule Agent for Trade Classification in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 makes this task straightforward by analyzing your product's data against global customs rules. For example, it might conclude a fitness tracker falls under the wristwatches category and provide legal notes to back this decision, keeping your team informed and in control. By transforming the complex classification process into a guided interaction, your trade professionals have more time to focus on strategy rather than paperwork. This not only enhances the speed and accuracy of your compliance processes but also strengthens your ability to meet market demands swiftly. With this AI innovation, your business can confidently and efficiently pursue global growth, minimizing delays and maximizing opportunities.

To learn more, consult our SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

 

Sales LoB

Elevating sales efficiency with AI-driven solution quotation management

Speaking of the Sales line of business, where time is of the essence, managing solution quotations can be a complex task. The introduction of Joule as a digital assistant in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 simplifies this process by allowing sales reps to execute tasks like creation, updating, and searching of solution quotations with conversational, natural language commands. This empowers sales teams to focus on high-value opportunities, such as quotations about to expire or those with significant client interest, and make well-informed decisions with clarity and speed. By streamlining the access to critical information, Joule helps reduce operational time and enhances the agility of sales professionals, allowing them to concentrate on building stronger customer relationships and fulfilling sales targets.

 

 

For more information read our dedicated pages on performing release and acceptance of solution quotations and fetching solution quotation information.

 

Seamlessly creating billing documents with AI

Imagine transforming the intricate process of billing document creation into an efficient, effortless operation‚Äîthis is where Joule steps in. The AI-powered capabilities of Joule allow users to effortlessly generate billing documents, whether they stem from a single reference or a collection of sales and delivery documents. This intuitive system supports the creation of both individual and collective billing documents, tailored to meet diverse business needs with pinpoint accuracy. For R&D departments, this means a streamlined workflow where administrative overhead is minimized, allowing more focus on innovation and product development. By simplifying navigation and enabling quick access to essential apps like Display Billing Documents, Joule enhances the accuracy and efficiency of billing processes, paving the way for more strategic decision-making. With this kind of intelligent assistance, your team spends less time on the nitty-gritty and more time driving the business forward.

 For more details, consult the SAP Help Portal.

 

Sourcing & Procurement LoB

AI-assisted creation of purchase requisitions 

Let‚Äôs take a look at the Sourcing & Procurement Line of Business. In this area creating purchase requisitions is a task that demands accuracy and efficiency. With the AI-assisted capabilities of Joule, the process becomes intuitive, allowing users, particularly casual ones, to navigate and complete requisitions merely through conversational prompts. This smart assistance helps in understanding various languages, correcting misspelled data, and even suggesting sources of supply promptly, thereby minimizing manual overhead and enhancing speed in decision-making. By embracing the future potential of speech recognition, Joule promises to make procurement tasks even more seamless, supporting operational purchasers in reducing free text entries and ensuring order clarity.

 For more details, refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Finance LoB

Simplified subscription order management*

In Finance, is often fragmented and error-prone. Teams spend valuable time reconciling contracts, processing changes, and ensuring compliance - effort that slows down financial operations and puts transparency at risk.

Joule tackles this challenge by simplifying subscription management end to end. It guides users through creating orders, automatically filling key fields once core details are entered. Contract information is easy to access and aligned with attributes like customer or product ID, while intuitive summaries provide quick snapshots of activation status. By streamlining these steps, Joule boosts efficiency, improves transparency, and allows businesses to focus on growth rather than administrative tasks.

 

For more information, consult the SAP Help Portal.  

 

Joule for cash management assistant*

Picture your finance team, once bogged down in manual cash flow tracking, now effortlessly navigating a sea of numbers with ease. With Joule, you can quickly verify if due bank statements are received, fetch opening balances, and factor in expected cash flows, all in one seamless process. By providing accurate calculations of expected closing balances, Joule proactively alerts you to potential cash shortages or surpluses. This efficiency not only saves substantial time but also empowers you to optimize cash usage strategically. In a world where timing is everything, having this level of clarity allows your business to maintain a robust financial footing and seize opportunities as they arise. 

 

 

For more details, refer to the SAP Help Portal. 

*planned availability in November 2025  with the  update of Joule framework

Supply Chain LoB

Joule navigation in SAP Fiori apps for extended warehouse management

In managing warehouse operations, finding the right tools quickly can make all the difference between seamless or sluggish performance. With the introduction of Joule copilot navigation in SAP Fiori apps for extended warehouse management, SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 enhances user experience by guiding employees effortlessly to the most suitable applications for their tasks. This AI-driven assistance not only accelerates warehouse processes but also minimizes the need for extensive user training, ensuring employees can focus on their core responsibilities rather than app navigation. The real value lies in the comprehensive insights this innovation provides, empowering users to make informed decisions that enhance efficiency across operations.

 Eager to learn more? Consult our SAP Help Portal.

 

Service Management LoB

Creating follow-ups for in-house service objects with Joule

Now let‚Äôs have a look at the Service Management LoB. Here, Joule's AI-driven capabilities enable service managers to easily search, display, and create follow-ups for in-house service objects using conversational interactions. This human-centric approach optimizes daily tasks by allowing managers to seamlessly access critical information and act upon it without the need for complex navigation. By streamlining these processes, service management teams can focus on what truly matters‚Äîdelivering quality service to their customers. Such enhancements in task efficiency lead to more responsive service operations, ensuring a proactive approach toward managing service demands.

 

 

For more information, refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Research and Development LoB

Intelligent project assistant capabilities with Joule

Navigating through a sea of data is commonplace in Research and Development (R&D) area, yet it doesn't have to be a drain on your team's creativity and productivity. The intelligent project assistant capabilities powered by Joule allow users to derive project data through natural language inquiries without the hassle of navigating multiple applications. This ease of access aids in quickly retrieving updates on project changes, identifying missing parts, and tracking due activities, all through Joule‚Äôs conversational interface. By supporting informational, navigational, and transactional capabilities, Joule transforms project management into a streamlined process, helping teams stay focused on innovation rather than administrative tasks. Moreover, the ability to open projects and WBS elements directly through Joule means that users can engage with their data more efficiently, fostering a productive and satisfied work environment. With these enhancements, businesses can ensure that their R&D projects are not only well managed but also effectively advancing toward their goals.

 

Navigating Bill of Materials with Joule

Imagine a workspace, where accessing Bill of Materials (BoM) is as straightforward as asking a colleague for the latest update, that's the seamless interaction Joule brings to the table. This AI-assisted natural language capability supports end users in navigating and managing BoM scenarios with ease, removing previous barriers to information. With Joule, users can effortlessly access header information, query BoMs by material-plant combinations, and select specific items, all through simple conversational prompts. Such simplification boosts productivity, allowing R&D teams to devote more time to product innovation and less to administrative navigation. By transforming BoM management into an intuitive, efficient process, Joule empowers users to make informed decisions, enhancing operational efficiency and ultimately driving business success.

For more information, refer to the SAP Help Portal.

 

AI-Enabled Precision in Handling Change Records

In Research and Development, managing change records is often time-consuming and complex. Teams must sift through detailed information, track overdue items, and ensure compliance ‚Äì all of which takes attention away from innovation.

Imagine handling change records as effortlessly as discussing project milestones with your team ‚Äì this is the transformative experience Joule brings to R&D operations. Joule simplifies interactions around change records, offering users intuitive access to detailed information at both header and item levels. By expediting the summarization process and enabling status changes, Joule ensures that overdue change records are discovered and addressed promptly, promoting efficient workflow and compliance. The capability to find records based on criteria such as product and reason for change further streamlines the management process, enabling teams to focus on innovation rather than paperwork. With these enhancements, R&D departments can make informed decisions more swiftly, driving their projects forward with the confidence that change management is both smooth and reliable.

 

For more details, refer to the dedicated pages on summarizing change record information and fetching change record information.

 

Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management

Streamlined project financials with Joule‚Äôs AI assistance

Handling complex financial data is one of the biggest hurdles in Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management. Now, picture managing a multifaceted project with the ease of a friendly chat ‚Äì that‚Äôs the vision Joule brings to life. With enhanced project assistant capabilities, Joule enables users to seamlessly access project financial and master data through intuitive natural language interactions. Gone are the days of toggling through applications and complex reports; now, project system users can effortlessly retrieve and summarize financial insights, aligning their focus on high-value tasks. This AI-driven ease not only boosts user satisfaction but also streamlines data collection and consolidation, making project management more efficient and effective. As a result, project teams can better navigate financial landscapes, ensuring that each decision supports the strategic vision. By leveraging Joule‚Äôs summarization and analytical prowess, organizations can enhance precision in project financial control, translating insights into impactful actions.


For more information, refer to SAP Help Portal. 

 

Summary

As we have explored, the SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release introduces a transformative suite of AI-driven innovations that redefine what‚Äôs possible in enterprise operations. By harnessing the power of specialized agentic AI and Joule, businesses are now equipped to navigate complexities with clarity and precision, leading to optimized processes and strategic growth. We‚Äôre excited for you to experience these advancements firsthand and to see how they can empower your organization to achieve its goals with new-found efficiency and insight. Thank you for joining us on this journey through the future of intelligent enterprise solutions. Stay connected for more updates by following the with the PSCC_Enablement tag as we continue to innovate and shape the path forward for businesses worldwide. Don't forget to follow me (@Yannick_PTT) in the community as well as on LinkedIn to not miss any updates and insights.

For more information on intelligent capabilities integrated SAP Cloud ERP Private, explore the SAP Help Portal. 

More information

  • What‚Äôs New Viewer
  • From Innovation to Impact: SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Release (SAP News Center)
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Community
  • Help Portal SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

entry.title: Stored procedure using INSERT...LOCATION fails with SQLSTATE QHA02 after RHEL upgrade
entry.content:
Hi,

On our two-node Redhat-hosted multiplex IQ 16.1 environment consisting of one dedicated write node and a dedicated read node we have an event triggering stored procedures to collect data using sa_conn_properties from both nodes to log connection activity to a connection log table.

Since the read node cannot perform write operations we use remote server and INSERT...LOCATION from the write node to read from sa_conn_properties on the read node and populate the connection log table.

This has worked just fine until we upgraded from RHEL 7.9 to RHEL 8.10. Now the event fails with SQLSTATE QHA02 every time the event repeats every minute calling the procedure that collects data from the read node. However, when calling the stored procedure manually it works as intended.

No database passwords have been changed and the stored procedure is run with SQL SECURITY INVOKER. No log entries are made in the iqmsg file on the read node. I really don't know how to troubleshoot this issue. Does anyone have any suggestions?

After the RHEL upgrade I receive this error every time:
I. 10/11 12:21:01.047674 Insert for 'CONNECTION_QUERY_INFORMATION' completed in 0 seconds. 0 rows inserted.
E. 10/11 12:21:01.082288 Handler for event 'evt_CONNECTION_QUERY_INFORMATION' caused SQLSTATE 'QHA02'
E. 10/11 12:21:01.082311 CtLibrary Error: 44, Severity: 0, Origin: 1, Layer: 4
Error Message: ct_connect(): protocol specific layer: external error: The attempt to connect to the server failed.
OS Error: 0, OS Message: ---.

Regards, Alexander

entry.title: Re: Currency Conversion with Prescribed Exchange Rates
entry.content:
Hi Joergen,

We have a new requirement related to currency exchange rate types. Currently, we have multiple company codes, and each company code uses its own exchange rate type (Z*), as the respective national banks provide their exchange rates. For all regular postings and clearing activities, the requirement is to use the Z* exchange rate type instead of ‚ÄòM‚Äô. However, during the revaluation process, the Leading Ledger (0L) should be valuated using the ‚ÄòM‚Äô rate type, while the Non-Leading Ledger (2L) should be valuated using the ‚ÄòZ*‚Äô rate type. Could you please let me know if there is any possible way to achieve this requirement?

entry.title: Seamlessly Expand from Event Mesh to Advanced Event Mesh with Our New Export Feature
entry.content:
Have you started your event-driven journey with the Event Mesh capability in SAP Integration Suite? It's the perfect service to begin, offering direct integration with SAP S/4HANA events and a focused feature set that caters to low to moderate event volumes. It‚Äôs ideal for businesses just beginning their EDA journey.

As your EDA implementation matures and expands, you may need to handle higher event volumes, require more sophisticated eventing capabilities, or need broader landscape coverage.

We are excited to announce that you can now easily expand from Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh to meet those demands. SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh is a separately priced offering that unlocks a new level of event management with powerful features, including:

  • Event Streaming: Handle massive volumes of events with advanced features like queuing, streaming, and replay.
  • Partitioned Queues: Ensure ordered processing by publishing messages with similar contexts to the same consumer.
  • Dynamic Message Routing: Automatically determine how to forward event messages within and across clusters.
  • Distributed Tracing: Trace the complete lifecycle of an event as it travels through the event mesh.
  • Flexible Deployments: Extend beyond public and private cloud environments to hybrid and on-premises broker deployments.
  • Event Management: Create, design, share, and manage various aspects of your EDA.
  • Event Monitoring and Insights: Curated dashboards, clear visualizations from historical and real-time metrics, with timely event broker notifications.

Learn more about SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh's key features and pricing here: What is Advanced Event Mesh?

Introducing "Export Configuration"

To make your transition journey smoother, we've introduced a powerful new feature directly in the Event Mesh UI: the "Export Configuration" button.

Screenshot of the Event Mesh in Integration Suite UI, featuring a new "Export Configuration" button in the top right corner

 

This new function is the first step to move to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh by downloading the configuration artifacts from Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite. With a single click, you can export your existing metadata ‚Äî including queues, topic subscriptions, and settings ‚Äî into a Terraform infrastructure-as-code (.tf) file.

To guide you through the expand process from Event Mesh to Advanced Event Mesh, we published a new migration guide. You can access it here: Migration from Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite to SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh

How Does the Migration Work?

The new export feature is the starting point for a streamlined, five-step migration process:

  1. Export: Navigate to the Event Mesh capability in the SAP Integration Suite UI and click the new "Export Configuration" button to download your .tf file.
  2. Edit: Open the downloaded file and add the credentials for your new, empty SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh broker instance.
  3. Import: Use standard Terraform commands (init, plan, apply) to automatically provision your queues and topic subscriptions in SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh.
  4. Adapt Applications: Adjust your sender and consumer applications to connect to the new SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh endpoints. This may involve updating connection details, libraries, and topic wildcard syntax.
  5. Migrate Applications: Choose a migration strategy that fits your needs ‚Äî either a phased, application-by-application rollout or a "big bang" switchover during a maintenance window.

This new process significantly reduces the manual effort and complexity previously associated with such a migration, allowing you to focus on leveraging the advanced capabilities of your new environment.

Ready to Get Started?

Unlock the full potential of your event-driven architecture and expand to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh today.

For a complete, step-by-step guide on the entire process, please refer to our official documentation on the SAP Help Portal:

Migration from Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite to SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh

entry.title: Create any deliveries SAP error VL455 ‚Äì No delivery-relevant items in order
entry.content:
OSS missing entries in follow tables: VBEP -OCDQTY_BU     and  VBEP-OCDQTY_SU

The SAP error VL455 ‚Äì "No delivery-relevant items in order" typically occurs when trying to create a delivery (e.g., with transaction VL01N) for a sales order that either:
All Sales orders work until last week now the document flow block all delivery with this message VL455
In your case, you"re using:
Sales order type: SRVO
Item category: SRVU
Delivery type: LF (standard delivery, often used for consignment fill-up)

No values in table 

The fields are VBEP -OCDQTY_BU     and  VBEP-OCDQTY_SU
Before we go to create a Delivery the document flow is set to Complete (BESTK =C)
 
After debug we fund that the date have been changing and the schedule line had a error.  Delivery are created for Sales order 1026  

Following table missing entries: The fields are VBEP -OCDQTY_BU     and  VBEP-OCDQTY_SU

entry.title: Second Half 2025 Release: What‚Äôs New in SAP SuccessFactors Mobile
entry.content:
Welcome to the next era of mobile HR! Our latest SuccessFactors Mobile release is packed with innovations designed to make your work life smoother, smarter, and more personalized than ever before. Whether you‚Äôre an employee, manager, these updates are crafted to empower you every step of the way.

 

Mobile Homepage: Your Work, Your Way  

Say hello to a unified, customizable mobile homepage! Now available as an opt-in for both mobile and web, this new experience brings: 

  • A vibrant, customizable splash screen for creative branding. 
  • A consistent header across iOS and Android for seamless navigation. 

‚ÄÉ

  • A redesigned Profile & Settings screen that puts key information and configuration options right at your fingertips. 
  • A completely rebuilt To-Do screen with powerful filtering‚Äîorganize and prioritize tasks like never before.  

People Profile Experience: Full Control, Full View 

The latest Mobile People Profile update gives you a consolidated Full Profile view and more autonomy over your data. Edit mode allows you to decide when and how to update your information. Full Profile View and Edit are both Opt-Out. Enjoy unified access to: 

  • Full Profile View, including User Information, Pension Payout, and Talent Trends. 
  • Effortless editing of Job Relationships. 
  • Additional enhancements like showing login names in profile previews, hiding categories for contingent workers, and supporting ‚ÄúSave to Contacts‚Äù directly from the profile. 

Joule Enhancements: Smarter Assistance for Everyone 

Joule just got a major upgrade! Now, employees can: 

  • Request leave or half-day absences directly in a conversational way. 
  • Instantly check leave balances‚Äîannual, sick, or any type‚Äîright from the app.
  • Add "Know the time-off rules and submit your leave request in under a minute."

Managers, get ready for a game-changer: 

  • Access performance and goals agents, reducing prep time by up to 75%. 
  • Focus on strategic work, not data digging. 
  • Create and execute actionable plans with all the right information at your fingertips. 

Plus, everyone can now submit feedback to help Joule get even better‚Äîthumbs up, thumbs down, and detailed comments are all welcome! 

New Learning Experience: Empowering Your Growth 

Continuous development is now easier than ever. Our enhanced learning tools support self-directed learning paths and deliver timely updates, so you can invest in yourself and your team‚Äôs growth‚Äîanytime, anywhere: support for optional curricula (self-assigned or admin/manager assigned) and improved integration with Open Content Network courses.

Geofencing for Mobile CICO: Clock In Where It Counts 

Compliance and employee experience just got a boost! With geofencing, users can only clock in or out when they‚Äôre within their designated work location. Define job sites, set boundaries, and give employees clarity on where they can record their time. 

Flexible Time Sheets: Work Smarter with Less Clicks 

Efficiency is the name of the game: 

  • Manage time sheets in various periods - such as monthly, bi-weekly, or weekly.

  • Copy-paste time sheet entries across multiple days - no more repetitive data entry. 

Effortless Half-Day Absences  

Clock time employees can now record half-day absences with ease. The system automatically aligns absences with planned working times and breaks, offering simple options (First Half / Second Half) and the flexibility to customize as needed. 

Org Chart Updates: Visual and Configurable 

Make your org charts work for you! Configure fields like photo and location to create more informative, visually engaging org charts that reflect your organization‚Äôs unique structure. 

Global Assignment & Concurrent Employment: Seamless Multi-Role Management 

Managing multiple assignments or employments? Now you can select which profile or assignment to use, manage data instantly, and take action for selected employment.

People Search Result Navigation: Direct & Consistent 

Find who you need, faster. Access profiles directly from search results, reducing unnecessary steps and ensuring a consistent experience across platforms. 

Why this Matters 

This release is a leap forward in usability, personalization, and operational efficiency. Every innovation is designed to make your SuccessFactors Mobile experience more intuitive, productive, and enjoyable. 


For more details please check the release notes here.

If you have questions, please leave them in the comments below, or ask them in the SAP SuccessFactors Mobile Forum.

Experience greater efficiency and enhanced performance by downloading the latest version of SAP SuccessFactors Mobile through the Apple App Store, Google Play Store, or Tencent App Store.

It's important to note that as of November 2025, the app will no longer support iOS 17.X on iPhone/iPad and Android 10.X. For more details, please refer to SAP SuccessFactors Mobile App to Deprecate Support for Apple iOS 17.X in November 2025 and SAP SuccessFactors Mobile App to Deprecate Support for Android 10.X in November 2025.


SAP SuccessFactors Mobile is a native app, which is available on iOS as well as on Android. It provides employees and managers access to HR activities anywhere at any time. The app is free of charge and can be used by every SAP SuccessFactors customer.

entry.title: How to write change pointers into MDGD_CP when a Z-table is updated (for DRFOUT Change Mode)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I'm currently working on a scenario where I want to send Material master data (BO=194) from S/4HANA to SAP Digital Manufacturing (DM) using DRFOUT in ‚ÄúChange Mode‚Äù, which is scheduled to run every 10 minutes.

Here is the situation:
„ÉªWhen I execute DRFOUT manually in Change Mode, it successfully retrieves data from the related Z-table, includes it in the IDoc, and sends it to DM without any issue.
„ÉªWhen the Z-table is updated, entries are correctly written to CDHDR/CDPOS and BDCP2.
„ÉªHowever, DRFOUT only generates IDocs when corresponding entries exist in MDGD_CP.
„ÉªTherefore, I would like to ensure that whenever the Z-table is updated, a change pointer is also written to MDGD_CP.
„ÉªI'm considering using the BAdI BDCP_BEFORE_WRITE to insert records into MDGD_CP at the same time as ALE change pointers are written.

My questions are:
„ÉªIs this approach (using BDCP_BEFORE_WRITE to create entries in MDGD_CP) technically valid?
„ÉªIf entries are successfully created in MDGD_CP, can DRFOUT in Change Mode pick them up and generate the IDoc automatically?
„ÉªAre there any additional steps or configuration required to make this linkage work properly?

Any insights, examples, or experience regarding this setup would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance,
Koichi Okamoto
