entry.title: Re: Incorrect Invoice Header Data Copied from Another Doc...
entry.content:
These type of issues would predominantly due to custom logic. Not sure, which user exit is implemented in your system. Normally, it would be USEREXIT_FILL_VBRK_VBRP or BADI_SD_CUST_HEAD or BADI_SD_BILLING. Here, set breakpoints or use logging to trace how VBRK-KUNAG and VBRK-KUNRG are populated during VF04. Review shared variables or buffers in custom code for proper clearing/resetting.

Having said that, the recommended fix would be refactor custom code to avoid global variables or ensure they are cleared at the start of each invoice loop. Use local variables within loops to isolate data per invoice. Implement proper partner determination logic using standard SAP routines unless customization is absolutely necessary. Test VF04 in a sandbox with logging enabled to reproduce and isolate the issue.

entry.title: Exploring Business Partner Master Data with SAP Joule, the AI Co-pilot
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs ever-evolving business landscape, quick access to business partners and their specific details is crucial for success. But this can be tedious and time-consuming when you have a lot of master data objects, especially when you want to quickly fetch some specific information related to a section of the master data without having to open the FIORI app and click through multiple facets in the user interface to locate the required information.

With the latest update of SAPJoule in October 2025, Business Partner master data brings you the power of AI. With Joule's robust functionality, you can easily access and view detailed information about your Business Partners, enhancing your ability to make informed decisions and streamline operations. This blog post explores how Joule can become your go-to assistant for easily accessing Business Partners efficiently.

 

A Closer Look at Business Partners

Joule offers features that allow users to delve into various aspects of Business Partner data. With Joule, you can explore:

  • Overview: Quickly access a summary of key information about your Business Partners.
  • Basic Details: Review fundamental data points, including organisation title and identifying search terms.
  • Roles: Understand the roles your Business Partners fulfil and their associated descriptions.
  • Addresses: Examine details of maintained and standard addresses across regions.
  • Industries: Gain insights into the industry classifications of your Business Partners.
  • Relationships: Explore the interconnected web of relationships between your Business Partners.

 

Joule‚Äôs Requirements

Before diving into Joule's capabilities, ensure you meet the prerequisites for access. You must be assigned the business role: SAP_BR_BUPA_MASTER_SPECIALIST to leverage Joule.

 

Practical Use Cases for Business Partners

Display Business Partner Overview

Kickstart your exploration by asking Joule to show you an overview of a Business Partner. For instance, entering the Joule prompt, "Display Business Partner Overview" followed by specifying an ID such as ‚Äú10238179‚Äù, will yield an informative card with essential details like Full Name, Business Partner ID, Category, and Communication Details.

 

Joule knows what else you might need

You read that right! Joule right away brings up the relevant supported details of the business partner in the form of quick links.

 

All that you must do is click any of the navigational links to view the corresponding details of the business partner. Everything in the same conversation window with Joule!

Joule also provides you with the navigation to the app where the business partner is stored. With just a click, you can open the object to view all its details or edit it to make changes.

Now let‚Äôs speed up things. What if you don‚Äôt want to go step by step. You know the business partner's number, and you quickly want to view some specific information. Well, Joule does that too!

 

Dive into Basic Details

To uncover foundational insights, ask Joule, "Show me basic data of business partner 10238179." This query retrieves critical information, including Authorization Group and Archiving Flags.

Unveiling Roles

Discover the various roles a Business Partner plays in your organisation by requesting Joule to "Display roles of business partner 10238179." Learn about the roles, their descriptions, and their validity periods.

 

Navigating Addresses

Addresses are pivotal in maintaining smooth communication. By querying "Display addresses of business partner 10238179," you can access all address entries and their specifics, ensuring that communication remains seamless.

Industry Insights

To understand the industry dynamics, ask Joule to ‚ÄúFor BP 10238179, show me industry details‚Äù. This reveals the Business Partner‚Äôs industry designations and systems.

Exploring Relationships

The intricate network of relationships is crucial for operational success. Joule can help display all related business partners by querying "Display relationship of BP 10238179," providing insights into all maintained relationships. Furthermore, for each related business partner, Joule reveals the Relationship Category, validity, and associated fields based on the relationship category.

 

Practical Use Cases for Customer Master Data

Display Customer Overview

Initiate your exploration of customer master data by querying an overview. Simply start with "Show me customers overview," and specify a Customer ID such as ‚Äú1007885‚Äù for detailed insights. Joule retrieves essential information like full name, Customer ID, and contact details.

 

It works the same way as that of Business Partner. Quick links help you fetch more relevant details about the Customer master data.

 

Navigate Customer Information

Dive further with specific queries like, "Show me customer information for 1023060," to uncover details such as account group, authorization group, order block, and classification indicators.

Exploring Sales Area Dynamics

To view a customer‚Äôs sales area specifics, ask Joule, "Display sales area of customer 1023060." For further exploration into individual sales areas, a query such as "Display sales area details of customer 1023060 with sales area 1010 10 00" reveals insights like sales office locations, shipping condition, and payment terms.

Tax Data Delve

Tax considerations are crucial. By querying, "Display tax data of customer 1023060 with sales area 1010 10 00," you can access location-specific tax classifications and descriptions.

 

Financial Engagement: Company Code and Dunning

Explore financial coordination by asking Joule for company code details, with queries like "Display company code of customer 1023060." At the same time, examining dunning data can optimize collections ‚Äì ‚ÄúDisplay dunning data of customer 1023060 with company code 4040" provides detailed procedural insights.

 

Conclusion

With this update, you can leverage Joule to access Business Partner and Customer objects. You can soon expect Joule for Supplier objects too.

Empower your business with Joule's capabilities and streamline your operations by effectively accessing Business Partner information. Whether it‚Äôs for ensuring precise communication or gaining industry insights, Joule stands ready to assist.

Embark on your journey with Joule today and redefine how you effectively access business partner and customer master data for success.

entry.title: Re: Issue with VAT Calculation in Asset Retirement via F-...
entry.content:
Good day @AlvaroFernandezMorales 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Post Retirement (Integrated AR) ‚Äì With Customer, Manage G/L Account Master Data

Tax Configuration Options for Key Users, Scope Items for Asset Accounting

To summarise, the scenario you described about system posting the asset sale to the customer account but no VAT line appearing even though a tax code is entered when you use Post Retirement with Customer app is common in public cloud.

The VAT not appearing during asset sale posting is caused by the revenue account not being tax relevant. I recommend you set Tax Category = Output Tax Allowed on that account and ensure that your VAT code is valid. Not that the system automatically calculates and posts the correct tax when performing an asset retirement with the customer.

Steps to consider are: (See further guidance below)

  • Use the Post Retirement (Integrated AR) ‚Äì With Customer app.
  • Ensure your revenue account allows output tax.
  • Repost it and VAT will be correctly calculated and shown in the journal entry.

 

Use the Post Retirment-With Customer app

Fill out the Asset number, customer, amount, and VAT code. Then proceed to show output Tax.

Go to Manage G/L Account Master Data √† Choose the Accounts √† Company Code Data √† Highlight Tax Category = Output Tax Allowed

Next, search for Automatic Account Determination. Then show mapping between Asset Class √† Transaction Key √† Revenue G/L

Then, search for Manual Journal Entries App. Display the final document with Customer, Revenue, and Output Tax lines.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: What is correct set up of Rebate sales condition type...
entry.content:
Why RES1 appears in RVAA01 instead of REA1 is because, in S/4HANA, the classic rebate processing (using REA1 and VBOX) is deprecated in favor of Settlement Management using Condition Contracts. RES1 is designed to accrue rebate amounts during billing (in RVAA01) and used again during settlement (in A10005) to calculate the final rebate amount. REA1 is not included in standard pricing procedures like RVAA01 or A10005 in S/4HANA because it belongs to the older rebate framework.

RVAA01: RES1 is used to accrue rebate amounts during billing. These accruals are posted to financial accounting.

A10005: RES1 is used again to calculate the final settlement amount during condition contract settlement (WB2R_SC or WB2R_SV).

Hi,

Nice, the same even can be done with native, enterprise databricks. or evey community edition. With FedML. Point is clear, views not tables. I have tested the funtionality with local tables and it works but not remote tables replicated for example from S/4HANA.

However, in my view the direction should be the SAP BDC connect(for production grade deployments) for Azure/Databricks since it is bi-directional with zero-copy delta share all the way to Unity Catalog that can be consumed directly by Azure infrastructure. Cheers, Happy blogging.
